H0.text: Maintain blood pressure is the function of the cardiovascular system working together with the respiratory system during exercise.

H1.text: Remove carbon dioxide is the action that the cardiovascular system works together with the respiratory system to perform during exercise.

H2.text: The production of red blood cells is what the cardiovascular system works together with the respiratory system during exercise.

H3.text: Filter out waste products is the action performed by the cardiovascular system working together with the respiratory system during exercise.

A4.text: It is therefore strictly speaking untrue that the primary function of the respiratory system is to rid the body of carbon dioxide 'waste'.

A5.text: Biological system in animals and plants for gas exchange

A6.text: The primary purpose of the respiratory system is the equalizing of the partial pressures of the respiratory gases in the alveolar air with those in the pulmonary capillary blood.

A7.text: Exercise increases the breathing rate due to the extra carbon dioxide produced by the enhanced metabolism of the exercising muscles.

A9.text: Peripheral oxygen uptake is reliant on a rerouting of blood flow from relatively inactive viscera to the working skeletal muscles.
